paragraph.paragraph: This document outlines the guidelines that should be adheared to when adding_clusters.xmlAdding New Clusters to an EiffelEnvision project.

EiffelEnvision projects promote ../project.xmlclean_separationClean Separation between project-specific items and Eiffel libraries. This separation should be maintained when adding_clusters.xmlAdding Clusters to projects. Diviating from this guideline may result in confusion in future editions of your project(s), for you or other developers sharing the project(s), because no distinction can be made between project files and Eiffel libraries.

When adding clusters, a cluster name will be requested. All clusters must have a name, and that name should be unique to the project regardless of it's location in the project (under url*Project Items or url*Eiffel Libraries.) By url*Convention, cluster names are lower-cased with words separated by underscores ('_'). Cluster names may be mapped to an assembly namespace when url*Built, based on your project's url*Cluster Namespace Format property. Therefore, cluster names should adhead to the .NET framework cluster namespace conventions. Both cluster and namespace conventions dictate that a name should begin with an alpha character and succeeded with alphanumericals or an underscores ('_'). Namespaces name allow periods ('.') as qualifiers, cluster names DO NOT.
